review: This was great. I did have to call my buddy in San Francisco and put him on speaker to install it. The instructions only seem good. And I never could figure out how to use it with my Amazon Prime. BUT, unfortunately, I had to return it. Comcast made it impossibly expensive for me to cut the cable cord. And I checked first, really I did. In addition, certain applications -- CBS access, for example -- don't work with the Fire TV Stick. That's important to know. I don't remember seeing that information anywhere. I look forward to being able to end my current relationship with Comcast. I will then see what the Fire TV Stick offers. I hope CBS and Amazon are able to play well together by then.
author: Nancy D. Solomon

review: The First TV Stick is lite and easy to use. It took no time to set up. The only issues I have with the product are sound and internet connectivity. I the first stick is on and I switch to a different HDMI Port the first stick sometimes loses connectivity and sound gets distorted. It took the stick 3 minutes to connect to my wireless modem which is located 4 feet underneath the stick.
author: Joshua Kovach

review: This was an easy set up. I now can get everything on a bedroom TV that did not have a Sony Google box. I wish I had this a long time ago. It is cheaper than the Google box and quicker to set up. Netflix and the Amazon Prime is running smooth. I am not a geek, so if I can set it up, anyone can. I love all the Amazon Prime TV shows! We would never have watched them otherwise.
